text: Hey guys, it's a Ro welcome to another Nerdy Nummies
I got so many requests from you guys to make something X-men related. I even dressed up a little bit
I have a little faux leather, edgy jacket on they called it vegan leather.
I'm not exactly sure what it's made out of, but I thought it looked like something
Rogue would wear. She is my favorite x-men
Let me know in the comments below who your favorite character is and today we are gonna be making
Homemade pretzels that look like the x-men logo and also I think this is the very first time we have ever made
Soft pretzels on nerdy nummies, so it's a very special day all right
Let's get started to make these soft pretzels the things you'll need for the dough will be 2 cups of bread flour
3/4 cup of all-purpose flou,r 1 cup of warm water, 1 packet of active dry yeast
2 teaspoons of sugar, 1 teaspoon of salt, 2 tablespoons of honey, and 2 tablespoons of butter
Then to top our pretzels, We're gonna be using 3 tablespoons of butter and a quarter cup of coarse salt now
Let's put it all together and make some pretzels first step is
Activating our yeast in front of me
I have a large mixing bowl our warm water. I heated this up in the microwave is about a hundred degrees our honey, sugar, and
Active dried yeast I use yeast a lot whenever I'm making breads like pizza
Dough's, or the brave rolls, or in the warm water sugar [singing] na na na na
honey, honey
Then whisk together until well combined and set off to the side for about 10 minutes to allow the yeast to activate
next step mix together your two flours, bread flour and regular flour, in a medium sized Bowl and
Whisk together and set off to the side. After the yeast has sat for 10 minutes. It's now awake. It's foamy
Add your butter, I've melted it in the microwave just pour it all in boop-boo-boo-boop then mix together
I'm using the spoon then add half the flour once again mixed together
We're adding a little bit of our flour before we add our salt because the salt
If you add it directly onto the yeast it can kill your yeast
so you want to add this as a buffer now add your salt a little mix it up and
Lastly continue adding your flour I'm gonna do it in half again. This is gonna help it absorb
Evenly this dough is starting to look good. It's time to get messy
We're gonna use our hands to continue to knead the dough take a pinch of flour
Sprinkle on top of your work surface of the dough doesn't stick and scoop it all onto the counter here
we go get on there [singing] I
love pretzels and pretzels love me shape the dough into a ball with your hands and
Continue to knead, push down, pull back, and turn
This is what you want your dough to look like you want it to be tacky
But not sticky and when you press your fingers in it springs back out once your dough is ready
It's time to let it rest in a large bowl add a little bit of oil I'm using the little paper towel to spread it
Around then place your dough in the middle of the bowl
And put a little oil on top just a little so as the dough grows it won't stick to your bowl
It will be easy to plop out using a clean kitchen towel cover the top, tuck your little dough in
Wa-doo-doo-doo-doo now we're gonna let our dough sleep for about an hour until it doubles in size, remember leave it out at room temperature
Don't put it in the refrigerator or in the oven just leave it out at room temperature
Alright, it's been about an hour. Let's check in on our dough, wake up. Oh
Yes, that's exactly what we want look at how much it rose. This is so cool now
We are gonna divide our dough into seven pieces to do that sprinkle a little flour in front of you on the work surface. Oh
Yes, this is my favorite part. I don't know why I just like how it flops out, flop
I'm using a bench knife
But you can use whatever you have around the kitchen
Divide your dough, just eyeball it into seven pieces
This recipe makes seven soft pretzels once the dough is divided into seven pieces
We're gonna shape our soft pretzel, so take one of the pieces of dough cut it in half and you're gonna roll
Into a log I've got two pieces rolled out with one of them, bring together,
Connect to make a circle, and pinch. You have to pinch
Really hard to get him to connect, with the second log cut in half, using your thumbs press each end
Into the pretzel really hard [singing] whoo look at that
x-men logo. Take your formed pretzel
And place over onto a greased lined baking sheet after you've got all the pretzels on a tray
I have half of them on this tray, half on another tray. They're going to take a nap again
Take a clean kitchen towel cover them up boo-boo-boo
Like this they're all tucked in and let them sleep for about 15 to 20 minutes
After your pretzels have taken a nap we're gonna take them and a large shallow
Saucepan with our baking soda and a spider, if you don't have a spider
You can use a large
Slotted spoon anything with like holes in it, makes it a little bit easier to scoop things out. We're gonna take all of these things
Over to the stove. we do this because this is what gives them their iconic taste and makes them a pretzel
Turn the stove heat to medium-low
And pour the baking soda into your pan and add 10 cups of water when the water is warm about 160 degrees
Carefully place a pretzel into the bath and let it sit for 30
seconds then flip it over and let it sit for an additional 30 seconds next
Remove the pretzel to a well oiled baking sheet, once you've done this to all of your pretzels
Take your tray back to the baking station. before you pop these in the oven,
Gently brush the tops of the pretzels with some melted butter
This is the 3 tablespoons of butter which I've melted just take a little baking brush and gently spread over the top then
Sprinkle a little bit of salt over the top and again
This is the coarse salt, and you can use as much or as little as you'd like
I like a lot of salt on my pretzels and now the pretzels are ready to bake heat your oven to
350 degrees and bake for 10 minutes and tada
Here are the x-men theme soft pretzels that we've made today

It makes my day, and if you have any other ideas for any other nerdy nummies
